Key Match Events: Alex Verdugo drove in the go-ahead run with a weak grounder to shortstop that Cleveland Guardians shortstop Brayan Rocchio couldn’t field cleanly in the ninth inning.

Pinch-runner Jon Berti scored to give the New York Yankees a 7–6 lead in the ninth inning and Gleyber Torres followed with a single to center field to drive in Anthony Volpe and boost the Yankees’ lead.
Tommy Kahnle closed out the ninth inning for the Yankees in an 8-6 victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run homer in the sixth inning, building the Yankees' lead to 6–2.
Cleveland rallied in the seventh, cutting the margin to 6–5 on consecutive one-out RBI doubles from Jose Ramirez and Josh Naylor off Clay Holmes.
David Fry hit a single in the eighth inning, adding another run for the Guardians.
Jhonkensy Noel drew a one-out walk and Andres Gimenez singled in the bottom of the ninth, bringing the game-winning run to the plate for the Guardians.
Bo Naylor flied out to center field, and Brayan Rocchio grounded out to second to end the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Tanner Bibee will start Game 5 with the Guardians' season at stake.
Carlos Rodon gets the starting nod for the Yankees on Saturday, with first pitch scheduled for 8:08 p.m. ET.
Post-Match Reflections: New York can clinch the AL pennant and a trip to the World Series with a win on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mark Leiter Jr. was added to the Yankees’ ALCS roster before the game as an injury replacement for Ian Hamilton.
